main_definition: To make an incision or separation in something using a sharp tool, or to reduce the amount of something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To remove or separate from (a larger thing) by dividing it into parts with sharp instruments such as scissors or knives
meanings_and_examples.example: She cut the ribbon to start the ceremony.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To lessen the amount, degree, or strength of something in a decisive way
meanings_and_examples.example: The company decided to cut its workforce by 10% due to financial difficulties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To reduce (an amount) by dividing it into smaller parts
meanings_and_examples.example: I need to cut my expenses this month so I can save money.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To remove or eliminate something unwanted, often abruptly and forcefully
meanings_and_examples.example: The manager had to cut ties with the unprofessional employee who was causing trouble in the office.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A short piece of paper that has been torn off a larger sheet or roll; also, words printed separately from a main text
meanings_and_examples.example: He handed me a newspaper and asked if I wanted to read this section as well.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To reduce (something) by cutting it down in size or amount
meanings_and_examples.example: The chef cut the vegetables into small pieces for the soup.
